WHEN IT COMES TO OFFERING PENNSYLVANIA SOMETHING NEW IN SLOTS MOHEGAN SUN AT POCONO DOWNS IS PLAYING YOUR GAME
The fabulous new $208 million Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs casino delivers over 2,500 of the hottest and newest slots and virtual table games.  Delivering all the latest games in denominations from one cent to $100 plus a luxurious High Limit slot room and private players lounge, Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs offers everything the discriminating slot player seeks. 
Rows and rows of gaming excitement, from the latest variations on the popular Wheel of Fortune games, Triple Red Hot 7's, Monopoly, Deal or No Deal and Hot Shot Progressives to the newest games such as the exciting debuts of Wizard of Oz and Dean Martin slots.  If video poker is your game of choice, we offer all the popular variations, including 33 multi-game machines at the exciting Sunburst Lounge, an elevated bar located at the center of the circular casino. 
Virtual table games is a great way to enjoy games such as blackjack and roulette in the form of a slot machine.  Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs offers virtual blackjack in denominations starting at $5 and games for both smoking and non-smoking guests. 
The new casino offers high ceilings and a state-of-the-art air handling system.  Seventy-five percent of the casino floor offers non-smoking slots while twenty-five percent offers a wide variety of options for guests who do smoke.  
Coinless ticket in-ticket out technology is offered on all games.
The smartest tip for all slot players is to sign up for a Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs' Player's Club card and use it every time they play our action-packed slot machines. New Players card members receive ten dollars in Free Slot Play for a limited time.  While you play, you earn points and each point has $1 in purchasing value.  Points earned while playing slots can be redeemed for price reductions or complimentaries at every restaurant, retail store or lounge.  Membership is absolutely FREE!

January
1- February 28
Start the New Year with a boatload of fun.
Set sail for warmer destinations and excitement with our big, free “Cruise Giveaway” on
Norwegian Cruise Lines! Enjoy up to 7 days at any of these destinations:
Mexican Riviera
Caribbean
Bermuda
Bahamas and Florida.
Earn 200 points during the promotional
period and we’ll give you an escape to
a dream destination. Earn 250 or more points and NCL will guarantee your
oceanside view.
CRUISE GIVEAWAY RULES & REGULATIONS
The Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs Earn A Cruise Giveaway
promotional period begins on January 1, 2009 at 6am and ends on February 28, 2009 at midnight.
Player’s Club Card holders who earn 200 points during the
promotional period with their Players card successfully inserted in a slot machine will be eligible for a 5-7 day cruise with Norwegian Cruise Line. If a player earns 250 or more points, NCL will guarantee a cabin with an oceanside view.
To be eligible for this giveaway, a patron must be 21 years of age or older and have both a valid government photo identification and a valid Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs Player’s Club card. Any people on the Excluded or Self Excluded lists are ineligible to earn entries or win any prize.
Norwegian Cruise Line is the guarantor of the cruise. The cruise must be taken within one year of issuance. The establishment of any and all arrangements for the cruise is between the winner and Norewegian Cruise Line.
Cruise winners are responsible for select fees associated with the cruise.
Employees of Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs and its affiliates are not eligible to participate in the promotion.
Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs reserves the right to cancel
or change this promotion at any time.
By participating in this promotion, you authorize Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs to use your name and/or likeness, photographic or otherwise, for such publicity purposes as deemed appropriate.
A valid government-issued photo identification is required
to claim any prize.
All applicable Federal and State taxes and/or miscellaneous cruise fees associated with the prize are the responsibility of the winner.
The cruise is non-transferable.
See Player’s Club booth for details. If you don’t have a Player’s Club card, it is easy and free to sign up. Visit the Player’s Club booth for more details

text:
Pocono Downs
History
Events & Promotions
General Information
Directions
Vendor Diversity Policy Statement
Contact A Host
Contact Us
BEYOND YOUR WILDEST EXPECTATIONS,
YET WITHIN REACH.
When is the last time you went out to someplace really exciting? Or had a night on the town where everything you could want was under one spectacular roof? Well, it just so happens that excitement lives and breaths right here in Northeastern Pennsylvania at Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs.
Being Pennsylvania’s first casino was great, but being Pennsylvania’s best casino was their goal. And they’ve succeeded in style, having recently completed Phase ll of Project Sunrise, a $208 million renovation that dramatically transformed them into the area’s leading entertainment complex. They’re also committed to celebrating the beauty and natural resources of Northeastern Pennsylvania. Inspiration for the architecture came from the rolling majesty of the Pocono Mountains and the richness of the Susquehanna River Valley. “Our focus and intent was to create a memorable design and experience which celebrates Northeastern Pennsylvania,” said Robert Soper, President and CEO of Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs.
With 55,000 square feet of new gaming space holding 2,500 slot and electronic virtual table games, many of them new to Pennsylvania, they offer countless opportunities for gaming fun and success. It also makes them unrivaled in gaming services and amenities. They’ve also brought in a variety of dining options that people in this area are craving. Whether it’s fine dining at Ruth’s Chris Steak House or Rustic Kitchen Bistro and Bar, casual dining at Timbers Buffet, or a delicious quick meal at the Sky Court Food Court, there’s something to satisfy every appetite. Shopping here is a whole new experience. Finely crafted jewelry, the latest fashions and accessories and a logo shop are just a few of the shopping opportunities available. And they put the ‘life’ in nightlife with the fabulous Sunburst Bar in the heart of the action, and eclectic entertainment and high kickin’ fun at Breakers Bar. There’s so much to do and see here that you really do need to experience it for yourself. And while it may be impossible to do all in one day, it’s the kind of place you’ll want to go back to time and again.
ABOUT THE AUTHORITY
The Authority is an instrumentality of the Mohegan Tribe of Indians of Connecticut, a federally recognized Indian tribe with an approximately 507-acre reservation situated in southeastern Connecticut, adjacent to Uncasville, Connecticut. The Authority has been granted the exclusive power to conduct and regulate gaming activities on the existing reservation of the Tribe, including the operation of Mohegan Sun, a gaming and entertainment complex that is situated on a 185-acre site on the Tribe’s reservation. Through its subsidiary, Downs Racing, L.P., the Authority also owns and operates Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs, a gaming and entertainment facility offering slot machines and harness racing in Plains Township, Pennsylvania and several OTW facilities located elsewhere in Pennsylvania.

These risks and uncertainties include, but are not limited to, those relating to increased competition (including the legalization or expansion of gaming in New England, New York, New Jersey and Pennsylvania), the financial performance of Mohegan Sun, Pocono Downs and the off-track wagering facilities, dependence on existing management, potential adverse changes in local, regional, national or global economic climates, the Authority’s ability to complete its current and proposed expansion projects at Mohegan Sun and Pocono Downs on time and on budget, the Authority’s leverage and ability to meet its debt service obligations, changes in federal or state tax laws or the administration of such laws, changes in gaming laws or regulations (including the limitation, denial or suspension of licenses required under gaming laws and regulations), and the continued availability of financing. Tannersville Inn

Free Admission! Friend a friend along!
Pocono Libertarians Background
Every locality has on-going discussions about community and national issues. They occur in service clubs, community organizations or the media. More often than not, though, they center on how to use the power of government to improve conditions or to solve problems, with a firm conviction that government can solve all problems and that it can do no harm.
Libertarians take issue with the involuntary means government uses to attain its ends. Mandates and prohibitions invariably limit the allowable range of experimentation. Freedom allows spontaneous order, which is seen in systems as diverse as artificial neural networks, agoric computers, biological evolution, ecosystems, and free-market economies. Many of the things that the government tries to do from good intentions could be better handled by spontaneous voluntary systems, and often governments attempts to impose solutions to problems do more harm than good.
Investor's Business Daily and the internationally published Financial Times featured stories pointing out the exponential growth of libertarian think-tanks and discussion clubs, like ours, which are once again focusing on the eternal conflict between government and freedom.
Founded in 1991, the Pocono Libertarians is a free monthly discussion forum bringing to Monroe County, Pennsylvania, interesting speakers and thought-provoking topics consistent with the philosophy of individual liberty, personal responsibility, free markets, and choice in all matters. It is the goal of the Pocono Libertarians to inject into the local dialog the premise that freedom does matter. To that end, we sponsor a free monthly discussion forum usually held at 7pm, the third Thursday of each month. We are proud of the programs we've hosted in our thirteen year history. Our monthly op-ed column entitled, "The Liberty Corner" can be read in the award-winning Community Express newspaper distributed throughout our area.
Our motto is, in the words of the late Nobel laureate Friedrich A. Hayek, " to make the building of a free society once more an intellectual adventure."
Read what Ernie Preate Jr., Former Attorney General of Pennsylvania and other past speakers have said about the Pocono Libertarians!
Don't forget to stop on by to sign and view our guestbook!
Don't forget to visit our Webrings!

Golf in Poconos a Great Christmas Gift
POCONO MOUNTAINS, PA - What do golfers in the Northeast crave this holiday season' Spring. The Pocono Mountains Visitors Bureau suggests placing the gift of golf under the Christmas tree this year with 2008 golf memberships and stay-and-play packages to any of the myriad courses in the four-county region. Memberships
range in price to include everything from scheduled weekday play to
unlimited golf at public courses or private clubs.
"While golfers love unwrapping a dozen golf balls or this year's hot
new gadget that promises to improve their game, what could be better
than opening a card that promises a season's worth of golf?" asks PMVB
Executive Director Robert Uguccioni. "The Pocono Mountains offer
championship courses that will challenge the best golfer as well as
options that are both economical and kind to the less-skilled player."
The Pocono Mountains: Discover Golf's Great Destination Secret, are
home to hundreds of holes of golf from legendary designers such as A.W.
Tillinghast, Donald Ross and Jack Nicklaus. With classic designs that
feature tight fairways and small greens, to expansive resort courses
and modern gems, the four-county region has something to satisfy every
taste.
Various stay-and-play packages are available for gifts as well. These are as varied as the courses themselves, such as an early-spring overnight to enjoy the budding flowers or a ladies day at the course with a trip to the spa after 18 holes of championship golf.
A complete list of Pocono Mountains golf courses and links to individual web sites can be found at www.poconosgolf.com. The venerable destination, with the brand campaign and slogan, "It's Time for the Pocono Mountains," also provides the ideal backdrop for corporate outings and meetings. If it's an overnight stay, a weekend getaway or an extended vacation, people are increasingly discovering the convenience and proximity of the Pocono Mountains properties and value-laden packages.
In addition to the many golf options, the mountain destination is blessed with numerous lakes and rivers, miles of marked and unmarked trails for hiking and biking, fine dining, shopping and historical site seeing. Gaming has come to the Pocono Mountains, as well, with Mount Airy Casino Resort introducing slot machines earlier this fall.
For more information on the area, visit www.800poconos.com or call 800-POCONOS (800-762-6667).
About the "Pocono Mountains: Discover Golf's Great Destination Secret"
The Pocono Mountains has long been known to avid travelers and mountain aficionados for its lush, relaxing family-friendly ambiance and romantic setting, as well as its fall foliage, winter skiing, spring-summer outdoor recreation options and natural beauty. Numerous lakes, parks and other environmental wonderlands are found throughout the four-county Pocono Mountains region.
Discerning golfers are well aware that the Pocono Mountains are home to golf courses designed by renowned architects such as Donald Ross and A.W. Tillinghast. Pocono Mountains golf properties and value-laden golf packages are available on www.poconosgolf.com, which allows players to enjoy majestic mountain-view scenery, the area's natural splendor, year-round amenities and unequaled value and variety.
Attributes of the golf-and-resort properties and destination include:
Home to hundreds of golf holes at numerous clubs, many located close to one another:
Two NASCAR races held annually each spring-summer
Golden Era of Golf Architecture period designs strongly represented by legendary designers Donald Ross and A.W. Tillinghast
Golf, lodging and resort accommodations at all price points, from luxury to value
Hiking, biking, camping, spas, horseback riding, boating, fishing, hunting and many other activities
Attractions, festivals and other special events
Meeting and conference facilities
Great food at a wide array of eating establishments and resort restaurants
Bed & breakfasts, country inns and resorts
Antique shops, outlet malls and other unique shopping venues

text:
Poconos Camp
Camp
Ramah in the Poconos
Camp
Ramah in the Poconos is located in the scenic mountain region of Wayne
County in Northeastern Pennsylvania. The natural beauty of the Poconos
provides an ideal setting for a summer camping experience. The camp
is approximately 3 hours driving time from both New York City and
Philadelphia.
Our modern pool and beautiful
lake provide the perfect setting for Red Cross certification, and
instruction in boating, canoeing, kayaking, sailing and windsurfing.
Sport choices include
basketball, baseball, floor hockey, soccer, volleyball, gymnastics
and tennis. Special sports programs include inter-camp games, sports
marathon, Ramah Tennis Open and Maccabiah. Campers are also exposed
to cultural arts through studio arts, photography, woodworking,
radio, dance and drama. Plays and other camp-wide cultural programs
are performed throughout the summer.
Basic outdoor
living skills are taught in camp through age appropriate experiences
culminating in backpacking and overnight hikes and canoe trips.
Ecology, the Jewish connection to nature, and camping skills
are integrated with group building and personal achievement
challenges.
Camp Ramah
in the Poconos offers a five-day Kesher Program for Jewish
families with deaf or hard of hearing members. It is the first
of its kind offered under the
auspices of
the Ramah camping movement. It was designed to enable Jewish
deaf children and adults to begin, or further develop, a Jewish
identity within the
format of a family camp program.
In
addition to the Kesher family camp, we offer a ten day camper
program for children who are deaf or hard of hearing. Children
from all over the United States live together in bunks with
counselors who themselves are also deaf. Kesher campers experience
the full Camp Ramah program including Jewish living, education,
tefillot, and
recreational programming while being integrated
into the larger camp program for electives and evening activities.
Director: Rabbi Todd Zeff
Assistant Director: Toby Ayash
Web Site: www.ramahpoconos.org

text:
2005 NASCAR Pocono 500 at Pocono Raceway Preview
Search
NASCAR Racing
HomeSportsNASCAR Racing
Email
NASCAR RacingFollow the RacesTeams & DriversHistory
Free NASCAR Racing Newsletter!Sign UpDiscuss in my Forum
2005 Pocono 500 at Pocono RacewayBy Steve McCormick, About.com
Filed In:History of NASCAR
> Previous Races
Superspeedway that drives like a road course: The most unusual track layout on the NASCAR schedule. Pocono Raceway has a massive front straight that often sees cars going
four, five and six wide. Add the high speeds to the challenging turns and you've got a 2.5 mile superspeedway that drives
like a road course.The Track: Pocono Speedway is a 2.5 mile three-cornered speedway. The triangle-shaped track has three different corner lengths and
bankings making it very difficult to set up a car and to drive well. Pocono is, in a word, unique.As difficult as it is to
set up and drive Pocono frequently hosts some great racing with races often decided within the last couple of laps.Race Distance: 200 laps = 500 milesThe Big Picture: This is race number 14 of 36. We are halfway to the cutoff. It is time to make your move if you want to race
for The Chase.
The current points top ten are: 1. Jimmie Johnson 1,912. 2. Greg Biffle 1,866. 3. Elliott Sadler 1,681. 4. Ryan Newman 1,672.
5. Tony Stewart 1,606. 6. Mark Martin 1,588. 7. Rusty Wallace 1,584. 8. Kurt Busch 1,579. 9. Carl Edwards 1,574. 10. Kevin
Harvick 1,573.Storylines: You'll hear a lot this week about the long front straightaway. At 3,740 feet the NEXTEL Cup cars reach 200MPH. Drivers actually shift part way down the straight. This is hard on transmissions and a missed shift can end your day early.The emphasis is truly on handling. Forget about turn one and the tunnel turn. The secret to being fast at Pocono is getting through the sweeping turn three which dumps you out onto the front stretch. If you can be fast there you'll put together fast laptimes.Media Coverage: TV: FoX Sunday June 12th 1PM Eastern.
Radio: MRN and XM Satellite
Actual Race: 1:40PM EasternLast Year: In 2004 Ryan Newman started on the pole but it was Jimmie Johnson who dominated most of the day to score the
win. In fact, Jimmie swept both Pocono races in 2004 in fairly dominating fashion.Predictions: Johnson dominated both Pocono races in 2004 and it's going to take a hardware failure to keep him from doing it again. He has been fast all year and this is a track he knows and loves.For my backup this week I'm going with a less obvious pick. Bobby Labonte has been having a
horrible 2005 season but Pocono is just the place where he could get back on track. He swept both races in 1999 and won again in 2001. Even though he hasn't found victory lane here recently he has had some good runs.
Suggested ReadingPocono Raceway ProfilePocono Produces First Time WinnerClassic Pocono Moment From Earnhardt Related Articles2005 NASCAR Pennsylvania 500 at Pocono Raceway Preview2008 Pocono 500 at Pocono Raceway2006 Pocono 500 at Pocono Raceway - NASCAR NEXTEL Cup RacePocono Raceway Profile2008 Sunoco Red Cross Pennsylvania 500 at Pocono Raceway

Pocono Real Estate - CENTURY 21 Select Group Poconos
 
 
Welcome to the Poconos Choice for
Real Estate and Vacation Rentals
Whether
you're looking for a primary home, a vacation
home, Pocono vacation rental or any kind of
Pocono Real Estate, CENTURY 21 Select Group
has something for you. We offer a broad range 
of homes within and surrounding the Poconos Region.
Blakeslee, Brodheadsville, Lake Wallenpaupack to Mount Pocono,
Pocono Lake, Lake Ariel, Lake Harmony, Hamlin/Lake Ariel, Hazleton,
Moscow, Hawley, Greentown, Honesdale, Hazleton and Tyler Hill are just a few of the regions that our offices serve.
Searching for Real Estate
On our site you can search through our Featured Listings, which include all listings from the CENTURY 21 Select Group Offices or You can search through both the Pocono Mountain MLS, PIKE/Wayne County MLS. and Hazleton MLS.
Vacation Rentals
The Pocono Region offers a multitude of recreational opportunities making it a wonderful place for a vacation. Skiing, snowboarding, sailing, rafting, golf, hiking and water parks are just a few adventures to be had in the Poconos. Many of our Pocono rental homes are located within communities that have lakes with beaches and boating, some even offer additional recreational opportunities such as tennis, golf, kids programs, fitness centers, indoor pools and more. For those interested in the excitement that slots bring, you can sneak away from your mountain vacation and try your luck at the recently built slots casino located just minutes from many of our rental homes. This is a private, non-profit country club, which in turn is owned by its member/property owners.
Certainly the main attraction is Lake Naomi itself. It is one of the largest private lakes in the Poconos.
A 100 foot "greenbelt", where many trees may not be removed, protects the lake and guarantees
a pristine, atmosphere...even though the lake is surrounded by hundreds of homes.
The lack of power boats ensures a clean, tranquil setting. The building pictured is the all new 48,000 square

Pocono
PA Green Commuting Resources
In the coming weeks, we hope to fill out this Pocono PA green commuting page to provide you with
valuable green commuting and carpooling information and connections. 
If you are looking for someone to car pool with, please send me an e-mail
and I will post your request on this page.
The Pocono area has a very limited amount of public transportation, so we
must compensate by carpooling, if we want to save money, fuel, and limit
dumping more carbon monoxide and carbon dioxide into the atmosphere.
For fun, check out this carbon

History of Poconos, Pennsylvania
Before the first permanent settlement at Shawnee by Nicholas Depui in 1725, Native Americans long lived in the Poconos. They were the Delaware, Iroquois, Shawnee, Minisink, Lenape, and Paupack. The Dutch arrived in 1659, but were forced out by the English in 1664. More English and the Germans came in and around 1742. Modern history begins with the first boarding house hotel, built in 1829 by Anthony Dutot. It became the center of the resort industry in the mid-1800s. At the turn of the century, vacationers from Philadelphia and New York City began to flock to the Poconos. Advertised as "Pennsylvania's Playground", the communities began a century's long serious development. Lake Wallenpaupack was created by damming the creek and building a hydro-electric plant. It became the third largest man-made lake in Pennsylvania, sizing at 5,200 acres and 52 miles of quiet, pristine shoreline. In the Poconos, a few eras have passed. During prohibition, the resorts were Puritan in spirit, calling themselves, "Friendly Mountain Resorts"; card-playing and gambling were prohibited and golf, tennis, and other sports were not allowed on Sundays. Before and after World War II, GIs took their wives and families. The Poconos was then dubbed the "Honeymoon Capital of the World". The heart-shaped tub was popularized here in 1963. To this day, resorts set the mood right for honeymooners and vacationing couples. By the 1950s, skiing took hold. The first snow maker (used by blowing water through a nozzle) was patented in the Poconos and then perfected by 1956. Interstates were constructed, which made the region more accessible. Eventually, a speedway was put in, bringing in at least 100,000 NASCAR fans from all over the country twice a year. As the Poconos has entered the 21st century, more resorts, restaurants, ski areas, and golf courses have arisen; property value has also arisen. Population of the entire region is upwards of 300,000 residents.

History

BEYOND YOUR WILDEST EXPECTATIONS,
YET WITHIN REACH.
When is the last time you went out to someplace really exciting? Or had a night on the town where everything you could want was under one spectacular roof? Well, it just so happens that excitement lives and breaths right here in Northeastern Pennsylvania at Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs.
Being Pennsylvania’s first casino was great, but being Pennsylvania’s best casino was their goal. And they’ve succeeded in style, having recently completed Phase ll of Project Sunrise, a $208 million renovation that dramatically transformed them into the area’s leading entertainment complex. They’re also committed to celebrating the beauty and natural resources of Northeastern Pennsylvania. Inspiration for the architecture came from the rolling majesty of the Pocono Mountains and the richness of the Susquehanna River Valley. “Our focus and intent was to create a memorable design and experience which celebrates Northeastern Pennsylvania,” said Robert Soper, President and CEO of Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs.
With 55,000 square feet of new gaming space holding 2,500 slot and electronic virtual table games, many of them new to Pennsylvania, they offer countless opportunities for gaming fun and success. It also makes them unrivaled in gaming services and amenities. They’ve also brought in a variety of dining options that people in this area are craving. Whether it’s fine dining at Ruth’s Chris Steak House or Rustic Kitchen Bistro and Bar, casual dining at Timbers Buffet, or a delicious quick meal at the Sky Court Food Court, there’s something to satisfy every appetite. Shopping here is a whole new experience. Finely crafted jewelry, the latest fashions and accessories and a logo shop are just a few of the shopping opportunities available. And they put the ‘life’ in nightlife with the fabulous Sunburst Bar in the heart of the action, and eclectic entertainment and high kickin’ fun at Breakers Bar. There’s so much to do and see here that you really do need to experience it for yourself. And while it may be impossible to do all in one day, it’s the kind of place you’ll want to go back to time and again.
ABOUT THE AUTHORITY
The Authority is an instrumentality of the Mohegan Tribe of Indians of Connecticut, a federally recognized Indian tribe with an approximately 507-acre reservation situated in southeastern Connecticut, adjacent to Uncasville, Connecticut. The Authority has been granted the exclusive power to conduct and regulate gaming activities on the existing reservation of the Tribe, including the operation of Mohegan Sun, a gaming and entertainment complex that is situated on a 185-acre site on the Tribe’s reservation. Through its subsidiary, Downs Racing, L.P., the Authority also owns and operates Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs, a gaming and entertainment facility offering slot machines and harness racing in Plains Township, Pennsylvania and several OTW facilities located elsewhere in Pennsylvania.

Pocono Downs
History
Events & Promotions
General Information
Directions
Vendor Diversity Policy Statement
Contact A Host
Contact Us
BEYOND YOUR WILDEST EXPECTATIONS,
YET WITHIN REACH.
When is the last time you went out to someplace really exciting? Or had a night on the town where everything you could want was under one spectacular roof? Well, it just so happens that excitement lives and breaths right here in Northeastern Pennsylvania at Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs.
Being Pennsylvania’s first casino was great, but being Pennsylvania’s best casino was their goal. And they’ve succeeded in style, having recently completed Phase ll of Project Sunrise, a $208 million renovation that dramatically transformed them into the area’s leading entertainment complex. They’re also committed to celebrating the beauty and natural resources of Northeastern Pennsylvania. Inspiration for the architecture came from the rolling majesty of the Pocono Mountains and the richness of the Susquehanna River Valley. “Our focus and intent was to create a memorable design and experience which celebrates Northeastern Pennsylvania,” said Robert Soper, President and CEO of Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs.
With 55,000 square feet of new gaming space holding 2,500 slot and electronic virtual table games, many of them new to Pennsylvania, they offer countless opportunities for gaming fun and success. It also makes them unrivaled in gaming services and amenities. They’ve also brought in a variety of dining options that people in this area are craving. Whether it’s fine dining at Ruth’s Chris Steak House or Rustic Kitchen Bistro and Bar, casual dining at Timbers Buffet, or a delicious quick meal at the Sky Court Food Court, there’s something to satisfy every appetite. Shopping here is a whole new experience. Finely crafted jewelry, the latest fashions and accessories and a logo shop are just a few of the shopping opportunities available. And they put the ‘life’ in nightlife with the fabulous Sunburst Bar in the heart of the action, and eclectic entertainment and high kickin’ fun at Breakers Bar. There’s so much to do and see here that you really do need to experience it for yourself. And while it may be impossible to do all in one day, it’s the kind of place you’ll want to go back to time and again.
ABOUT THE AUTHORITY
The Authority is an instrumentality of the Mohegan Tribe of Indians of Connecticut, a federally recognized Indian tribe with an approximately 507-acre reservation situated in southeastern Connecticut, adjacent to Uncasville, Connecticut. The Authority has been granted the exclusive power to conduct and regulate gaming activities on the existing reservation of the Tribe, including the operation of Mohegan Sun, a gaming and entertainment complex that is situated on a 185-acre site on the Tribe’s reservation. Through its subsidiary, Downs Racing, L.P., the Authority also owns and operates Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs, a gaming and entertainment facility offering slot machines and harness racing in Plains Township, Pennsylvania and several OTW facilities located elsewhere in Pennsylvania.

"VICTIMS RIGHTS"

Practitioner in civil and criminal law with an emphasis on family law
Wednesday, June 21, 2006
7:00 PM
Tannersville Inn
Route 611
Tannersville, PA
Free Admission! Friend a friend along!
Pocono Libertarians Background
Every locality has on-going discussions about community and national issues. They occur in service clubs, community organizations or the media. More often than not, though, they center on how to use the power of government to improve conditions or to solve problems, with a firm conviction that government can solve all problems and that it can do no harm.
Libertarians take issue with the involuntary means government uses to attain its ends. Mandates and prohibitions invariably limit the allowable range of experimentation. Freedom allows spontaneous order, which is seen in systems as diverse as artificial neural networks, agoric computers, biological evolution, ecosystems, and free-market economies. Many of the things that the government tries to do from good intentions could be better handled by spontaneous voluntary systems, and often governments attempts to impose solutions to problems do more harm than good.
Investor's Business Daily and the internationally published Financial Times featured stories pointing out the exponential growth of libertarian think-tanks and discussion clubs, like ours, which are once again focusing on the eternal conflict between government and freedom.
Founded in 1991, the Pocono Libertarians is a free monthly discussion forum bringing to Monroe County, Pennsylvania, interesting speakers and thought-provoking topics consistent with the philosophy of individual liberty, personal responsibility, free markets, and choice in all matters. It is the goal of the Pocono Libertarians to inject into the local dialog the premise that freedom does matter. To that end, we sponsor a free monthly discussion forum usually held at 7pm, the third Thursday of each month. We are proud of the programs we've hosted in our thirteen year history. Our monthly op-ed column entitled, "The Liberty Corner" can be read in the award-winning Community Express newspaper distributed throughout our area.
Our motto is, in the words of the late Nobel laureate Friedrich A. Hayek, " to make the building of a free society once more an intellectual adventure."
Read what Ernie Preate Jr., Former Attorney General of Pennsylvania and other past speakers have said about the Pocono Libertarians!
Don't forget to stop on by to sign and view our guestbook!
Don't forget to visit our Webrings!

Geography Videos
More Geography Videos »
Pocono Mountains, a mountainous area in northeastern Pennsylvania. It is a part of the Appalachians. The mountains extend northeast-southwest and form part of the eastern edge of the Allegheny Plateau. The Poconos' maximum elevation is about 2,200 feet (670 m) above sea level. Scenic slopes, forests, and lakes make the Poconos a popular resort area.

The
Top 5 Tables in The Poconos - Where
to go, where to sit and who you'll see at the 5
top Pocono Mountain restaurants. You'll want to
read this before making those dinner reservation!
Poconos
dining is from casual to elegant. Make dinner reservations
prior to your arrival (best to do it when you make
your hotel
reservations) during most seasons.
Pictured: The French Manor
Make
Reservations Online for These Pocono Restaurants:
Blakeslee
Inn & Restaurant
- Rt 940 Blakeslee, PA 18334
The best kept secret in the Poconos - a "Foodies"
delight! The award winning Blakeslee Inn has raised
the bar on "Fine Dining" in the Poconos area. The
freshness of its exquisite dishes and premiere wine
selections are beyond compare. An exceptional experience
awaits those who dine here; an undercover gem -
The Blakeslee Inn. Executive Chef - Jim Evans.
$$$
Smugglers
Cove
- (seafood) - Rt. 611 Tannersville.
Voted
the Best "Seafood" restaurant in the mountains
4 years running. Well thought out menu with a great
variety. Efficiently prepared and a clean, interesting
decor. Go here on the "off nights" for the best
of food and service. Menu with tantalizing appetizers
like Coconut Shrimp or Baked Silver Dollar Mushrooms
stuffed with crabmeat. One Cove Favorite: Pan Seared
Mustard & Poppy Seed Encrusted Salmon, served with
lemon tarragon sauce. Try Shrimp & Chicken Primavera,
or Crab au Gratin (fine Maryland crab meat served
with a light blended cheese sauce & baked en casserole
'til golden brown). $$$
Baileys
Steakhouse
(steak) - Rt. 611, Pocono Blvd,
Mt. Pocono
Open seven days a week, you'll want to make reservations
during the "high times" of summer and ski season.
Grilled Chicken, Barbecue, Steak, Burgers, Sandwiches,
and Salads. A sister to Smuggler's Cove, run by the
same family for years and well done at that!
Steakhouse
starters include Mesquite Grilled Shrimp & Chicken
Quesadillas. Then have Bailey's Tenderloin Kabob,
seasoned & double skewered with fire-roasted vegetables
& tender filet cuts, choice of potato or served over
rice pilaf. From the Open Barbecue Pit, dig into Hickory
Smoked Genuine Baby Back Ribs served with fries, coleslaw
& cinnamon apples./font>
$$$
Crescent
Lodge - Paradise Valley
Cresco, Pennsylvania
The excellence of the restaurant has been widely widely
recognized. The chef offers an varied and full menu
of classic American cuisine along with an extensive
seletion of fine wines (It's worth the trip just for
the wine list). The meals are beautifully presented
by an attentive staff in a charming, warm, homey atmosphere.
Quiet, clean place with English Pub style lounge.
$$$$
The
Homestead Inn
- Sand Spring Drive, Cresco, PA -
Relaxed Country Dining, 2 aquariums and an intimate
fireplace. Extensive wine selection, AAA rating for
15 years, Quality assurance approval with 97% rating,
25 years of private ownership. Unique entrees like,
Filet Au Poive, Sweet Baby Crab Cakes, Grilled Pork
Tenderloin,Veal Musketeer, Vegetable Raviolis w/ Sweet
Red Pepper Sauce, Escargot, and Snapping Turtle Soup.
Open year around, and located in the heart of the
Poconos. Major Credit cards accepted. $$$
Meadowbrook
Inn -
Cherry Lane Rd., Tannersville, PA
Enjoy dining for every appetite in a relaxed setting
and choose from an award winning international cuisine
while having a quiet drink by the fireplace in the
newly renovated Derby Pub. A Four Star dining experience.
With accomplished Chef. Entrees such as: Filet Mignon,
Vegetable Paella, Rosemary Chicken Ravioli,Pork Chop,
Canadian Duck Breast, Pan-Seared Artic Char $$$$
The
Willowtree Inn, Ann Street Stroudsburg,
PA
Occupies a renovated house, lately the home of a former
Monroe County Prothonotary, hard by the north bank
of McMichael's Creek off Ann Street in Stroudsburg.
Against this background, and not in the least either
because of its very fine menu, The Willowtree Inn
has prospered. An established haven and watering-hole
for many upstanding members of the Community. The
tables in its rear dining room, have a panorama of
the creek dominated by a magnificent weeping willow
tree, from which its name derives, are sought after.
$$
Serengeti
Bar & Grill,
Rt.611, Bartonsville, PA
The Serengeti Bar & Grill is the place to be in the
Poconos, with great food, friendly service and an
inviting atmosphere, all at a price that you can afford!
The Serengeti has been serving up breakfast, lunch
and dinner for 6 years and has earned an excellent
reputation and won many culinary awards. $$
The
Sycamore Grille
Main and Oak Streets, Delaware Water Gap PA,.
Open 7 nights a week, 5 PM till? Tradition American
Food. Features like: Filet Mignon - with mustard
mashed potatoes and caramelized shallot shiraz demi
glace. Delmonico Steak. Grilled Salmon over wild
rice pilaf with red wine balsamic and strawberry
glaze. Crabmeat Stuffed Jumbo Shrimp with tarragon
cream sauce over wild rice pilaf. Crabmeat Stuffed
Jumbo Scallops over herb roasted red potatoes. Maryland
Crab Cakes. Twin Char Grilled Lobster Tails. Surf
and Turf. Veal Oscar. Veal Martini. Chicken Saltimbocca
- proscuitto, mozzarella and spinach with a marsala
mushroom sauce over wild rice pilaf and vegetable.
$$$

Starting to feel the holiday crunch? Summer vacation too far away? SundanceVacations.com is here to offer you a cure to your stressful schedule. Pocono Getaways are a great way to unwind, relax, and rejuvenate your mind and body, no matter what the time of year. At great prices for superior accommodations, you can enjoy a higher caliber of vacation. Whether it's just a weekend or a month long retreat, Discount Pocono Getaways from SundanceVacations.com are just the cure for your busy lifestyle.
The Pocono Mountain region of Pennsylvania offers a wide range of activities to appeal to any age or interest. From outdoor adventures to spectacular spa experiences, the Poconos have what you need to get your mind and body back on track. Escape the daily grind with SundanceVacations.com.
As part of our Pocono Getaways, SundanceVacations.com offers you luxurious accommodations at the Woodfield Manor. Close to the Mount Airy Casino, the Woodfield Manor is situated on 12 beautiful acres, showcasing 13 cozy cottages and six appointed manor suites. These two-room suites and cottages feature a warm fireplace for creating ambiance or a little romance during your visit, making your stay even more special. Your lodgings will also have the following for your convenience and satisfaction:
Flat panel televisions
Coffee and tea services
Wooden hangers
Microwaves
Iron & ironing board
Refrigerators
Sleep sofas in the living areas
Hair dryers
Clock radios with MP3 and iPod connections
Fine dining experiences, a cocktail bar, business services, and heated pools are just some of the features you'll enjoy on your Serene Pocono Getaway to the Woodfield Manor. During your stay, be sure to take advantage of the picnic packages, The Chophouse Restaurant, and the atmosphere of the Pocono Mountain region. The Woodfield Manor rustic surroundings, luxurious lodging.

text:
Pocono Downs
History
Events & Promotions
General Information
Directions
Vendor Diversity Policy Statement
Contact A Host
Contact Us
BEYOND YOUR WILDEST EXPECTATIONS,
YET WITHIN REACH.
When is the last time you went out to someplace really exciting? Or had a night on the town where everything you could want was under one spectacular roof? Well, it just so happens that excitement lives and breaths right here in Northeastern Pennsylvania at Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs.
Being Pennsylvania’s first casino was great, but being Pennsylvania’s best casino was their goal. And they’ve succeeded in style, having recently completed Phase ll of Project Sunrise, a $208 million renovation that dramatically transformed them into the area’s leading entertainment complex. They’re also committed to celebrating the beauty and natural resources of Northeastern Pennsylvania. Inspiration for the architecture came from the rolling majesty of the Pocono Mountains and the richness of the Susquehanna River Valley. “Our focus and intent was to create a memorable design and experience which celebrates Northeastern Pennsylvania,” said Robert Soper, President and CEO of Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs.
With 55,000 square feet of new gaming space holding 2,500 slot and electronic virtual table games, many of them new to Pennsylvania, they offer countless opportunities for gaming fun and success. It also makes them unrivaled in gaming services and amenities. They’ve also brought in a variety of dining options that people in this area are craving. Whether it’s fine dining at Ruth’s Chris Steak House or Rustic Kitchen Bistro and Bar, casual dining at Timbers Buffet, or a delicious quick meal at the Sky Court Food Court, there’s something to satisfy every appetite. Shopping here is a whole new experience. Finely crafted jewelry, the latest fashions and accessories and a logo shop are just a few of the shopping opportunities available. And they put the ‘life’ in nightlife with the fabulous Sunburst Bar in the heart of the action, and eclectic entertainment and high kickin’ fun at Breakers Bar. There’s so much to do and see here that you really do need to experience it for yourself. And while it may be impossible to do all in one day, it’s the kind of place you’ll want to go back to time and again.
ABOUT THE AUTHORITY
The Authority is an instrumentality of the Mohegan Tribe of Indians of Connecticut, a federally recognized Indian tribe with an approximately 507-acre reservation situated in southeastern Connecticut, adjacent to Uncasville, Connecticut. The Authority has been granted the exclusive power to conduct and regulate gaming activities on the existing reservation of the Tribe, including the operation of Mohegan Sun, a gaming and entertainment complex that is situated on a 185-acre site on the Tribe’s reservation. Through its subsidiary, Downs Racing, L.P., the Authority also owns and operates Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs, a gaming and entertainment facility offering slot machines and harness racing in Plains Township, Pennsylvania and several OTW facilities located elsewhere in Pennsylvania.

These statements can sometimes be identified by the use of forward-looking words such as “may,” “will,” “anticipate,” “estimate,” “expect,” or “intend” and similar expressions. Such forward-looking information involves important risks and uncertainties that could significantly affect anticipated results in the future and, accordingly, such results may differ materially from those expressed in any forward-looking statements made by or on behalf of the Authority. These risks and uncertainties include, but are not limited to, those relating to increased competition (including the legalization or expansion of gaming in New England, New York, New Jersey and Pennsylvania), the financial performance of Mohegan Sun, Pocono Downs and the off-track wagering facilities, dependence on existing management, potential adverse changes in local, regional, national or global economic climates, the Authority’s ability to complete its current and proposed expansion projects at Mohegan Sun and Pocono Downs on time and on budget, the Authority’s leverage and ability to meet its debt service obligations, changes in federal or state tax laws or the administration of such laws, changes in gaming laws or regulations (including the limitation, denial or suspension of licenses required under gaming laws and regulations), and the continued availability of financing. Additional information concerning potential factors that could affect the Authority’s financial results is included in its Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended September 30, 2007, as well as its other reports and filings with the SEC. text:
Pinecrest Lake Information - Pocono Lake Realty, Pocono Pines, PA
Pinecrest Lake
Secluded in the heart of the Pennsylvania Pocono Mountains, Pinecrest
Lake Offers the ultimate in Vacation Home Accommodations in a private
Estate setting. The homes are clustered in a natural pine fourst immediately
adjacent to Pinecrest Lake. Pinecrest Lake has been developed by leisure
Oriented professionals to provide not just a quality vacation home community
but also a superior vacation experience. The Poconos have been known
for decades as being Pennsylvania's playground. It is only a short distance
from Pinecrest Lake Resort to Championship Golf Courses, Major Pocono Ski
Areas, gift shops, attractions, and a selection of restaurants that
range form specializing in gourmet cuisine to catering to family needs.
You'll like the Poconos and you'll fall in love with Pinecrest Lake.
Lake and Swimming Pool
Pinecrest Lake's on site amenities include a 77 acre lake with guarded
beach area, boating and fishing. Our Mountain sized outdoor heated swimming
pool has a diving and water slide area, and a separate area for swimming
laps or just playing around. For the little ones there is a wading pool
apart from the main pool. The pool deck has lots of chaise lounges for
you to relax the day away.
Tennis Courts
The Tennis Complex Features 8 Har-Tru tennis courts and has been designed
by serious tennis Professionals.
Nature Trails
For the nature enthusiasts, Pinecrest Lake offers 2200 acres to explore
with jogging and cross country skiing trails.
Furnishings
Each Vacation home is fully furnished including washer/dryer, cable
television and equipped to provide home away from home comfort. Each home
has a spacious living-dining room complete with a wet bar and wood burning
fireplace for those chilly nights. The kitchen comes with dishwasher, refrigerator
with ice maker, micro-wave and self-cleaning oven, and all the pots, pans,
utensil, tableware and glassware you need for vacation dining.
In the Poconos, you can enjoy quiet country
living in contemporary style. Come to the Pinecrest
Lake...

Midweek Stay-and-Play Specials in Poconos
POCONO MOUNTAINS, PA - The Pocono Mountains Visitors Bureau announces midweek stay-and-play specials within the "Pocono Mountains: Discover Golf's Great Destination Secret" golf cooperative.
While many courses offer 18- or 36-hole midweek special, some of the resorts add to the package by including overnight resort
accommodations in the Pocono Mountains - an ideal place to relax and
reconnect. Whether planning a midweek break or a weekend getaway, it's
time for the Pocono Mountains.
"While the weekends have always been popular among visitors to the
Pocono Mountains, our co-op members are reaching out to prospective
guests by offering hard-to-resist specials during the week," says
Robert Uguccioni, executive director of the Pocono Mountains Visitors
Bureau. "The area remains beautiful throughout the week. By planning a
weekday visit to the Pocono Mountains, golfers can avoid the usual
weekend traffic and unwind with a relaxing round." 
Midweek packages range from a night's accommodations and a full breakfast to a bottle of champagne and participation in a half-day short game school. For a comprehensive list of courses and midweek packages, visit www.poconosgolf.com.
The Pocono Mountains offer a variety of playing options - from classic designs by legendary architects like Donald Ross or A.W. Tillinghast to modern gems by Jack Nicklaus and his contemporaries. Whether golfers are looking for a championship layout to test their skills or an affordable, player-friendly course for every member of the family, the Pocono Mountains have something for everyone.
Off the golf course, the four-county offers fine dining, luxurious spas, historical site seeing, boating and miles of hiking and biking trails - all in a lush, mountain setting.
For more information on the area, visit www.800poconos.com or call 800-762-6667.
About the "Pocono Mountains: Discover Golf's Great Destination Secret"
The Pocono Mountains has long been known to avid travelers and mountain aficionados for its lush, relaxing family friendly ambiance and romantic setting, as well as its fall foliage, winter skiing, spring-summer outdoor recreation options and natural beauty. Numerous lakes, parks and other environmental wonderlands are found throughout the four-county Pocono Mountains region.
Discerning golfers are well aware that the Pocono Mountains are home to golf courses designed by renowned architects such as Donald Ross and A.W. Tillinghast. Pocono Mountains golf properties and value-laden golf packages are available on www.poconosgolf.com, which allows players to enjoy majestic mountain-view scenery, the area's natural splendor, year-round amenities and unequaled value and variety.
Attributes of the golf-and-resort properties and destination include:
Home to hundreds of golf holes at numerous clubs, many located close to one another:
• Two NASCAR races held annually each spring-summer
• Golden Era of Golf Architecture period designs strongly represented by legendary designers Donald Ross and A.W. Tillinghast
• Golf, lodging and resort accommodations at all price points, from luxury to value
• Hiking, biking, camping, spas, horseback riding, boating, fishing, hunting and many other activities
• Attractions, festivals and other special events
• Meeting and conference facilities
• Great food at a wide array of eating establishments and resort restaurants
• Bed & breakfasts, country inns and resorts
• Antique shops, outlet malls and other unique shopping venues

text:
Pocono Downs
History
Events & Promotions
General Information
Directions
Vendor Diversity Policy Statement
Contact A Host
Contact Us
BEYOND YOUR WILDEST EXPECTATIONS,
YET WITHIN REACH.
When is the last time you went out to someplace really exciting? Or had a night on the town where everything you could want was under one spectacular roof? Well, it just so happens that excitement lives and breaths right here in Northeastern Pennsylvania at Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs.
Being Pennsylvania’s first casino was great, but being Pennsylvania’s best casino was their goal. And they’ve succeeded in style, having recently completed Phase ll of Project Sunrise, a $208 million renovation that dramatically transformed them into the area’s leading entertainment complex. They’re also committed to celebrating the beauty and natural resources of Northeastern Pennsylvania. Inspiration for the architecture came from the rolling majesty of the Pocono Mountains and the richness of the Susquehanna River Valley. “Our focus and intent was to create a memorable design and experience which celebrates Northeastern Pennsylvania,” said Robert Soper, President and CEO of Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs.
With 55,000 square feet of new gaming space holding 2,500 slot and electronic virtual table games, many of them new to Pennsylvania, they offer countless opportunities for gaming fun and success. It also makes them unrivaled in gaming services and amenities. They’ve also brought in a variety of dining options that people in this area are craving. Whether it’s fine dining at Ruth’s Chris Steak House or Rustic Kitchen Bistro and Bar, casual dining at Timbers Buffet, or a delicious quick meal at the Sky Court Food Court, there’s something to satisfy every appetite. Shopping here is a whole new experience. Finely crafted jewelry, the latest fashions and accessories and a logo shop are just a few of the shopping opportunities available. And they put the ‘life’ in nightlife with the fabulous Sunburst Bar in the heart of the action, and eclectic entertainment and high kickin’ fun at Breakers Bar. There’s so much to do and see here that you really do need to experience it for yourself. And while it may be impossible to do all in one day, it’s the kind of place you’ll want to go back to time and again.
ABOUT THE AUTHORITY
The Authority is an instrumentality of the Mohegan Tribe of Indians of Connecticut, a federally recognized Indian tribe with an approximately 507-acre reservation situated in southeastern Connecticut, adjacent to Uncasville, Connecticut. The Authority has been granted the exclusive power to conduct and regulate gaming activities on the existing reservation of the Tribe, including the operation of Mohegan Sun, a gaming and entertainment complex that is situated on a 185-acre site on the Tribe’s reservation. Through its subsidiary, Downs Racing, L.P., the Authority also owns and operates Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs, a gaming and entertainment facility offering slot machines and harness racing in Plains Township, Pennsylvania and several OTW facilities located elsewhere in Pennsylvania.

These risks and uncertainties include, but are not limited to, those relating to increased competition (including the legalization or expansion of gaming in New England, New York, New Jersey and Pennsylvania), the financial performance of Mohegan Sun, Pocono Downs and the off-track wagering facilities, dependence on existing management, potential adverse changes in local, regional, national or global economic climates, the Authority’s ability to complete its current and proposed expansion projects at Mohegan Sun and Pocono Downs on time and on budget, the Authority’s leverage and ability to meet its debt service obligations, changes in federal or state tax laws or the administration of such laws, changes in gaming laws or regulations (including the limitation, denial or suspension of licenses required under gaming laws and regulations), and the continued availability of financing. Otterlake
Campground
 
Campgrounds in the Poconos
Pocono Vacations Park for RVers
Our featured campground in the Poconos is Pocono Vacation
Park ~ the best year round campground for family fan and entertainment!
Offering weekly live entertainment, "chip and putt" golf for
adults, swimming pool, basketball and volleyball courts, playground and
activities for the kids. Enjoy all the comforts you deserve are used to,
(watch cable TV, call your friends and surf the Internet) while away from
it all in the beautiful Pocono Mountains. For more information e-mail
carlet@ptd.net or visit www.poconovationpark.com
Otter Lake Campground
Otter Lake Camp Resort offers 250 acres of spacious
wooded campsites where you can discover new pleasures with each new season.
Fishing and hiking in the spring, swimming and boating in the summer,
hunting and foliage-watching in the fall, and a variety of sports during
the winter months. Once you get here, paved roads lead to your beautiful
wooded campsite. A fireplace, picnic table, electric, water, sewer, and
cable facilities all are waiting for you. Drive-through trailer sites
and tent sites are also available. Our excellent facilities include: eight
deluxe heated tile rest rooms and separate hot showers with private dressing
areas; a fully stocked store for all your camping needs; two dump stations
and two fully equipped laundromats. Firewood and propane gas facilities
are available on the premises. For more information call (570).223.0123
or visit www.otterlake.com
Mountain Vista Campground
Mountain Vista Campground is nestled in the scenic Pocono
Mountains and features large wooded sites with 50, 30 or 20 amp electric
service as well as water and sewer hookups, cable TV hookups, cabin rentals,
RV rentals, camping store with RV supplies, ice, firewood and more. On
site recreation includes swimming pool, stocked fishing pond, tennis court,
sand volleyball court, game room, table tennis, shuffleboard, bocce court,
horseshoe pits, badminton, basketball, playground, planned activities
and entertainment. The campground is conveniently located for the Pocono's
nearby attractions including the Delaware Water Gap National Recreation
Area, golf courses, shopping, flea markets, attractions and restaurants.
Visit www.mtnvistacampground.com

Bishwind
Poconos Bed & Breakfast
 
Poconos Bed and Breakfast / Inns
Bishwind Poconos Bed and Breakfast
Our featured Poconos Bed and Breakfast is the Bishwind
historic English style bed and breakfast, located in Bear Creek. History
surrounds this peaceful, elegant place which has hosted personalities
like Theodore Roosevelt, William Howard Taft and Sikorsky among others.
Lovely decorated bedrooms and suites with fireplaces, jacuzzi baths, terraces
overlooking the garden and a wide array of amenities that surpass what
you'd normaly expect from a B&B. For more information call (570).472.3820
or visit
their website
Black Walnut - Bed and Breakfast Country Inn
Charming would be the word that best defines this 12
rooms stone house. This delightful, newly restored 1890's Inn is a beautiful
Tudor-style stone house with historic fireplace, antique furnishings and
brass beds. Wake up with the smell of a hearty, home-cooked breakfast
and enjoy it while overlooking their 4-acre pond. Take the kids to the
on-site petting zoo or relax on the large back deck with outdoor hot tub.
Couple getaway, family trip or group outing, the Black Walnut has something
for everyone. Call for more information (570). 296.6322 or visit www.theblackwalnutinn.com/aboutthe.htm
The Inn at Jim Thorpe
Located in the historic village of Jim Thorpe, the Inn
was built in the 1840's and lovingly restored to bring back memories of
the Victorian opulence. From their room furnishings to the entire architecture
style you can feel the . Personalities like Thomas Edison and John D.
Rockefeller have passed through the Inn. For more information call (800).329.2599
or visit www.innjt.com

To see the image and video player for Caesars Pocono Resorts you need to enable javascript and have the latest version of flash which can be downloaded at Adobe's web site.
Find Love Anew in the Heart of the Poconos!
If you haven't been to Caesars Pocono Resorts lately, you really haven't been here. This is the original Pocono Mountains romantic resort - the heart-shaped tub was born here, and you've never seen anything like the plush, romantic havens guaranteed to enrapture you in unbounded passion. Today Caesar Pocono Resorts is one of the last true romantic Pocono destinations, and is still an unparalleled escape; premier accommodations are set in the majestic Pocono Mountains. Luscious touches include a full range of amorous new activities, amenities and products that afford the ultimate in pampering. Its standout all-inclusive resorts - Cove Haven, Paradise Stream and Pocono Palace - feature enchanting lodgings and endless activities for retreats that are beyond comparison.
All InclusiveLeave it all divine dining, stately lodgings and live entertainment to the resort's friendly, attentive staff. Delight your taste buds in all-you-can-eat breakfast and dinners daily. With its Key Around Club, youl get exclusive access to all three resortsactivities from golfing and sailing to tennis and billiards.
GolfWhile all its resorts feature a guaranteed good time mini golfing, Pocono Palace is serious fun for seasoned golfers with a 9-hole regulation course, driving range and putting green. Watch your ball soar past mighty pines, through challenging fairways and onto velvety greens. Golf pros are even available for lessons!
LakeThese resorts are the epitome of on-the-water fun - every property rests along a scenic lake! Discover the excitement of water skiing as your sweetheart cheers you on; or find serenity in a sailboat or paddle boat, cruising along on those resplendent waters. From fishing to speed boating, it all here for you to enjoy!
LuxurySink into velvety sheets of a king bed; take a swim in your suite pool and then soak in its seven-foot-tall champagne glass whirlpool. A day of waterskiing, racquetball and horseback riding, followed by a massage and superb five-course dinner it just a glimpse of the luxuries awaiting you at Caesar Pocono Resorts!
MountainIntimately situated in the lush Pocono Mountains, these resorts afford vivid views from the suitespicture windows or balconies. You can head down to the lake to enjoy the scenery while you fish, sail or relax on the shore. Explore the mountains year round with downhill skiing in winter and horseback riding in summer.
NatureYoul never feel closer to each other or to nature than when you stay at Caesar Poconos Resort. Let the falling snow enchant you while skiing or snowmobiling in the thrilling Pocono Mountains. From compelling water sports to peaceful horseback rides, there year round outdoor fun waiting for you at Caesar Pocono Resorts.
RomanticYoul feel like the VIPs of romance at Caesars Pocono Resorts. A personal concierge helps you celebrate everything from weddings, honeymoons and vow renewals to simply being together. Extravagant packages include couplesmassages, new activities, champagne, and sumptuous suites with king beds and heart-shaped whirlpools.
Hotel SuitesThis selection of fully-adorned spaces cannot be classified in one term - each is its own fantasy, with names like Diana's Oasis and Garden of Eden Apple. Choose from intimate Jacuzzi Suites to the fantastic, 4-level Champagne Tower by Cleopatra, with 7-foot tall champagne glass tub. The Roman Tower Suite is the ultimate!
LodgesNot to be forgotten, the simple elegance of an old-fashioned lodge is included in Caesars Poconos' Club Lodge suites featuring breathtaking Pocono Palace Echo Lake views.
Villas And CondosSuites such as the Lakeside Chalet and Lakeside Villa feature a grand Roman style with secluded lakefront balconies and the world-famous heart-shaped whirlpool bath-for-two. Luxury amenities include a cozy log-burning fireplace, shower-for-two with dual showerheads, and BOSE 321 Surround Sound Entertainment System.

Most Recent Review
 “Caesars Forever Lover Guest”
January 4, 2009
By: PoconoLover - See all my reviews
Location:
1 of 1 found this review helpful
My husband and I have been going to Caesars Pocono Resorts for 13 years. We have gone every year. We had our honeymoon at Pocono Palace. We like the resort because it is all inclusive, relaxing, has night activities, beautiful grounds, great activties. Wh have stayed at all of their resorts in the Poconos and like Pocono Palace for its view over the lake from the rooms and the dining room. We like the activity directors at Pradise Stream. Each resort it slightly different but each has positive things to offer. You can go the the Caesars resorts and not have to worry about tipping, dinner or breakfast bills, or cover charges. The resort is all inclusive. The only thing you may need to buy is lunch. We were sorry to see that the Brookdale on the Lake resort was sold. Even though we will still go every year.
Some guests have complained about the service being a little slow in the dining room. It can be, but we did not care because we wanted to take our time and relax. The staff has alot of people to serve in a short period of time.
I have special dietary need and all I had to do it call the kitchen with my special needs and they took care of me.
Some of the activities are x-rated and some people may not like that. We have taken our parents with us and they would just skip those activities.
All in all, we love Caesars and will continue to return.

text:
Pocono Plateau | Friedwald
Visit this forest or contact us for further information!If you would like to take a guided walk through the forest conducted by the local Naturalist please
 
contact the EcoEternity service center.
m tx m (Tt0)VirginiaPennsylvaniaGermanySwitzerland
EcoEternity Forest at Pocono PlateauThe Pocono Mountains of Northeastern Pennsylvania, USA offer 2,400 square miles of wooded peaks and valleys with numerous sparkling lakes, rushing rivers, and some of the loveliest waterfalls in the east. The Pocono Mountains are divided into five regions: Upper Delaware River Region, Lake Region, Delaware River Region, Mountain Region and Lehigh River Gorge Region.Seeing is Believing - come on out and visit our forest!
Director Rev. Ron Schane
Pocono Plateau is a beautiful mountaintop setting that consists of 750 acres of wooded land, two lakes, natural wetlands and a variety of wildlife habitats.
Read more
Services & Prices
Pocono Plateau offers the full EcoEternity burial options.
Click here to download detailed information about services and prices (PDF).
Directions
Find your way to Pocono Plateau!
 
Click here to get interactive journey planners and detailed directions.
Rev. Ron Schane, Director of Pocono Plateau
Detail Map of the EcoEternity ForestAbout Pocono PlateauLocated In the heart of the Pocono Mountains of Pennsylvania the EcoEternity Forest at Pocono Plateau is an hours drive from Allentown and Scranton, and about two hours from Philadelphia and New York City.
 
For over 60 years, the forest has been used to provide a place for Christian Summer Camps and Retreats.  Only parts of the forest are used for such activities. A large portion of the forest has been allowed to mature untouched by man.
A nature walk through the woods will reveal a large variety of indigenous trees such as American Beech, Black Cherry, Eastern Hemlock, Red Maples, Sugar maples and various Birches.  Hay-Scented Ferns, Lowbush Blueberry, and Princess Pine cover the forest floor.  In the Spring and Summer, the beauty of the forest is ever present between the Shadbush, Rhododendron and wildflowers.  In the Fall, the forest is a parade of autumn colors.
 
Pocono Plateaus mission is to provide opportunities to experience the Gospel of Jesus Christ though recreation, challenge and reflection.  There is no better place to reflect upon lifes choices than being surrounded by Gods beautiful creation.  The EcoEternity Forest allows our ministry to impact lives on the most challenging aspect of life preparation for death - by focusing on the hope of the Gospel message.
Rev. Ron Schane, Director of Pocono PlateauTo topPocono PlateauPA-191 & Pocono Plateau Rd Cresco, PA 18326

Golf in the Poconos
 
Golf in the Poconos
Golf in the Poconos with Pocmont Resort & Tamiment
Golf Club
Pocmont Resort, the premier conference an recreational
facility in Northeast Pennsylvania, is now the proud, exclusive partner
of the historic Tamiment Golf Club, a classic Robert Trent Jones Sr. designed
course. For more information contact (800).762.6668 or visit www.pocmont.com/golf/
About the Golf Course
Designed by the late Robert Trent Jones Sr. in 1947,
Tamiment Golf Club
features a historic and scenic mountain top course that is nestled in
the spectacular Pocono region and just 5 minutes away from Pocmont Resort.
The classic style design features tree lined fairways, majestic views,
undulating greens and strategically placed bunkers.
Originally established in 1947, Tamiment Golf Club is a traditional golf
experience that provides it's golfing guests with the opportunity to experience
a golf course that was created prior to the days of island greens, railroad
ties and "Hershey Kiss" shaped mounding. Golf purists will appreciate
the layout that is not cluttered with hazards, yet rewards the golfer
who takes a well thought out approach to playing each hole.

Description of the Pocono Lake vacation home rental
If you are looking for the perfect vacation home, then you found it! This cozy, immaculate 3 bedroom home is only a few blocks away from two of three community pools. This home, a perfect getaway during any season, is located in the most prestigious vacation community in the Pocono's. Perfectly situated on a private wooded lot in Arrowhead Lakes, a gated resort community in the Pocono Mountains. This home features the best of vacationing with an abundant array of activities at your fingertips! Whether you want an action packed, exciting vacation adventure or you want a peaceful getaway - this is the home for your special vacation!
Cozy up in front of the gas fireplace in the wide open living room or enjoy TV with digital cable and a DVD player. Home also features wireless high speed internet. The kitchen is very well equipped so you can prepare any meal. Each individual bedroom features a private television with cable. Take advantage of the three season room with fantastic views of the surrounding woods or relax on the beautiful large private deck.
Area Description
Arrowhead Lakes is a premier amenity filled community located on a huge lake, and only a few miles to Jack Frost & Big Boulder ski areas. The community offers 24 hour security, 2 stocked lakes with beaches, 3 pools, playgrounds, tennis & basketball courts, boat rentals and organized activities. We are a short walk to a beautiful heated pool, playground and game room. Jack Frost & Big Boulder Ski Resorts are just 15 minutes away! Enjoy water parks in the summer and the best of Pocono Skiing in the winter! The Jack Frost PGA Rated Golf Course is just minutes away. Coming Soon - Split Rock INDOOR WATER PARK! Brand New MT AIRY CASINO RESORT is just 16 miles from home - Enjoy the brand new casino, fine dining, nite life and Spa! The New MOHEGAN SUN CASINO is just 25 minutes from home - over 1000 slots and horse racing too!! POCONO RACEWAY NASCAR RACING 12 miles from home! Golf, Outlet Shopping, Mountain Biking, Hiking, White Water Rafting, Horse Back Riding and MORE-all nearby!

Caesars Forever Lover Guest -
PoconoLover
January 4, 2009
1 of
1 found this review helpful
My husband and I have been going to Caesars Pocono Resorts for 13 years. We have gone every year. We had our honeymoon at Pocono Palace. We like the resort because it is all inclusive, relaxing, has night activities, beautiful grounds, great activties. Wh have stayed at all of their resorts in the Poconos and like Pocono Palace for its view over the lake from the rooms and the dining room. We like the activity directors at Pradise Stream. Each resort it slightly different but each has positive things to offer. You can go the the Caesars resorts and not have to worry about tipping, dinner or breakfast bills, or cover charges. The resort is all inclusive. The only thing you may need to buy is lunch. We were sorry to see that the Brookdale on the Lake resort was sold. Even though we will still go every year.
Some guests have complained about the service being a little slow in the dining room. It can be, but we did not care because we wanted to take our time and relax. The staff has alot of people to serve in a short period of time.
I have special dietary need and all I had to do it call the kitchen with my special needs and they took care of me.
Some of the activities are x-rated and some people may not like that. We have taken our parents with us and they would just skip those activities.
All in all, we love Caesars and will continue to return.
This review is the subjective opinion of a ResortsandLodges.com® member and not of ResortsandLodges Inc.

Golf Package Vacations to a 'Classic'
Plan a Trip to the Pocono Mountains Region of Pennsylvania!
The
allure
of the Pocono Mountains Region of Pennsylvania is no secret
– it brought in the vacationing members of the Rat Pack back in the
1950s and 60s looking to get away from the every day.  Now this
scenic area, known for its amazing landscapes, is drawing golfers
who want to step into the pages of yesteryear and golf on classic
courses in style or challenge themselves with newer course
additions. 
We invite you to take your next golf trip vacation to the Pocono
Mountains where you can choose from 13 golf courses for the ultimate
golf-around. Mother Nature laid the framework for amazing
courses throughout this region, and they are all worth the visit. 
From hilly fairways to mountainous backdrops, every course makes use
of its natural surroundings to present you with a test of golf that
you will never forget. Some of best names in golf design have carved
out classic golf layouts that can stand the test of time - from
golf designers Donald Ross, Jim Fazio, Nicholas Psiaha, Robert White and A.W.
Tillinghast to newer names such as Terry Lagree and many others.  
Genesis has partnered with the best golf courses and
hotels in the area to give you an experience that is unsurpassed by
other destinations of its type.  As a region, the Pocono Mountains
has been catering to visitors for over a century, as you will soon
see upon your arrival in this dynamic golf destination!  In addition to
sensational courses and accommodations, golfers will find a large
variety of 19th hole options, from casual fare to fine dining to
even casino nightlife. There is truly something for everyone in the
Pocono Mountains!
 
When it is All About the Game
What makes a golf trip memorable will always be the same. Laughing
with friends, pursuit of the ever-elusive eagle, and being treated
like the pros. Some things just never change.
And then again… some things do.
Genesis Golf Trips
offers customized golf packages combining features that golfers
should always expect: affordability and course variety into a golf
experience that exceeds your group's desires.
Golf Packages Made Easy
We are experienced packagers that love the game of golf and know
what it takes to put together a great golf package. Whether you
are
planning a golf vacation for four or forty, you will receive a great
hassle-free golf value. So, call us today and spend less time
planning and more time playing!
Genesis Golf Trips…The NEW Swing in Golf
Packaging!
 
Instant Package Quotes Online!
Now booking your golf package is even easier. Submit your Pocono Mountains Golf
Package request over the Net.
Check Out Our
Special Offers
Looking for a great bargain? Making last minute plans? Check out our online
listing of golf package specials.
Sign-up for
"E-News"
We'll send you our quarterly newsletter with the latest golf course and hotel
news and special golf package offers.
 
 
 
2009 Genesis Golf Trips. Genesis Golf Trips is a premier golf packaging company specialized in developing new golf package destinations in the Eastern United States for golfers to enjoy on an extended and multiple golf course golf vacation. The Pocono Mountain Region of Pennsylvania area spans over 4 counties and offers over 12 golf courses and 7 accommodations in Carbon, Monroe, Pike and Wayne counties. As the official golf packaging firm for the Pocono Mountain Visitors Bureau, Genesis Golf Trips can offer golfers access to multiple golf courses and hotel accommodations for the ultimate golf around golf trip in the Jim Thorpe, Lake Harmony, Delaware Water Gap, Stroudsburg, Tannersville, East Stroudsburg, Mount Pocono, Buck Hill Falls, Marshalls Creek, Bushkill, Kresgeville, Pocono Manor areas of the Pocono Mountain Region of Pennsylvania.
